meanings.definition: A contract in which one party hires another to perform part of the work that was originally agreed upon with a third party.
meanings.sent1: The construction company signed a subcontract with a plumbing company to handle the installation.
meanings.sent2: The subcontract outlined the specific tasks the subcontractor would complete for the project.
meanings.sent3: The subcontract between the two companies made sure the plumbing work didn't go down the drain.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, a subcontract can be like passing the baton in a relay race.
meanings.sent5: The subcontract agreement was as clear as a blueprint, detailing every aspect of the job.

meanings.sent1: The main contractor decided to subcontract the electrical work to a specialized company.
meanings.sent2: She subcontracted the painting job to a local artist known for their attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he would subcontract his chores to his dog if he could.
meanings.sent4: Subcontracting the task felt like delegating a crucial mission to a trusted ally.
meanings.sent5: The decision to subcontract was like hiring a skilled assistant to lighten the workload.
